meanings.definition: Of or relating to the period before the existence of life.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the prebiologic conditions on the planet.
meanings.sent2: The prebiologic era was a time of extreme conditions on Earth.
meanings.sent3: In a prebiologic world, there were no plants or animals to be found.
meanings.sent4: The prebiologic landscape was barren and devoid of any living creatures.
meanings.sent5: Imagining a prebiologic Earth helps us appreciate the complexity of life.

meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the development of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The ancient rocks contained prebiologic evidence of early life forms.
meanings.sent2: Fossils from the prebiologic era provide insights into our planet's history.
meanings.sent3: The prebiologic world was like a silent stage waiting for the actors to arrive.
meanings.sent4: The prebiologic environment was a canvas waiting for the brushstrokes of life.
meanings.sent5: Studying prebiologic conditions helps us understand the origins of life on Earth.
